content: वृत्तिः {%<ab>f.</ab>%} [वृत्-क्तिन्] {@--1@} Being, existence. {@--2@} Abiding, remaining, attitude, being in a particular state; as in विरुद्धवृत्ति, विपक्षवृत्ति &c. {@--3@} State, condition. {@--4@} Action, movement, function, operation; शतैस्तमक्ष्णामनिमेषवृत्तिभिः <ls>R. 3. 43</ls>, <ls>Ku. 3. 73</ls>, <ls>Ś. 4. 14.</ls> {@--5@} Course, method; <ls>Ś. 2</ls>, <ls n="Ś.">11.</ls> {@--6@} Conduct, behaviour, course of conduct, mode of action; कुरु प्रियसखी वृत्तिं सपत्नीजने <ls>Ś. 4. 17</ls>, <ls>Me. 8</ls>; वैतसीवृत्तिः, बकवृत्तिः &c. {@--7@} Profession, occupation, business, employment, mode of leading life (often at the end of <ab>comp.</ab>); वार्धके मुनिवृत्तीनां <ls>R. 1. 8</ls>; <ls>Ś. 5. 6</ls>; <ls>Pt. 3. 125.</ls> {@--8@} Livelihood, maintenance, means of subsistence or livelihood, <ab>oft.</ab> in <ab>comp.</ab>; <ls>R. 2. 38</ls>, <ls>Ś. 7. 12</ls>, <ls>Ku. 5. 28</ls>; (for the several means of subsistence, see <ls>Ms. 4. 4-6</ls>). {@--9@} Wages, hire. {@--10@} Cause of activity. {@--11@} Respectful treatment. {@--12@} Gloss, commentary, exposition; सद्वृत्तिः सन्निबंधना <ls>Śi. 2. 112</ls>, काशिकावृत्तिः &c. {@--13@} Revolving, turning round. {@--14@} The circumference of a wheel or circle. {@--15@} (In <ab>gram.</ab>) A complex formation requiring resolution or explanation. {@--16@} The power or force of a word by which it expresses, indicates, or suggests a meaning; (these are three अभिधा, लक्षणा, and व्यंजना q. <ab>q. v.</ab> v.); general character or force of a word. {@--17@} A style in composition (these are four; कैशिकी, भारती, सात्वती and आरभटी <ab>q. v.</ab>). {@--18@} Customary allowance. {@--19@} Manner of thinking.
